alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval; Eastern Clay; Inland St. Johns; South Central Duval; Trout River; Western Clay; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Johns, northern Clay and central Duval Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from Cisco Gardens to near Doctors Inlet to near Camp Blanding. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Mandarin, Fruit Cove, Arlington, Middleburg, Baymeadows, Cisco Gardens and Ortega. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. For boaters on or near the St Johns River or Intracoastal waterway, move to a safe shelter now! Do not be caught on or near the water. Gusty winds and choppy waves are likely. Make sure all on board are wearing life jackets. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Duval; Eastern Clay; Inland St. Johns; South Central Duval; Trout River; Western Clay; Western Duval
